sections.heading: What is それで?
sections.content:
それで means "so," "and then," "therefore," or "and because of that." It connects sentences to show that the second sentence is a result or consequence of the first. It's more neutral than だから, focusing on narrating what happened next rather than emphasizing causation.

雨が降った。それで家にいた。 "It rained. So I stayed home." 疲れた。それで早く寝た。 "I was tired. So I went to bed early."

children.heading: Sentence 1. それで Sentence 2.
children.content: 忙しかった。それで行けなかった。 "I was busy. So I couldn't go." Between sentences Shows result

children.heading: Showing result/consequence
children.content: 道が混んでた。それで遅れた。 "The road was crowded. So I was late." お金がなかった。それで借りた。 "I didn't have money. So I borrowed some." Natural consequence

children.heading: Continuing narrative
children.content: 駅に着いた。それで友達に電話した。 "I arrived at the station. And then I called my friend." Sequential events Neutral tone

children.heading: Asking "And then what?"
children.content: A: 映画を見た。 B: それで？ A: "I watched a movie." B: "And then? / So what?" Prompting continuation

children.heading: Beginning of second sentence
children.content: 失敗した。それで諦めた。 "I failed. So I gave up." After period New sentence

children.heading: Works in both
children.content: Casual: 疲れた。それで休んだ。 "I was tired. So I rested." Polite: 疲れました。それで休みました。 "I was tired. So I rested." Neutral connector

children.heading: Explaining situations
children.content: 電車が遅れた。それで遅刻した。 "The train was delayed. So I was late." 病気だった。それで休んだ。 "I was sick. So I took a day off." Giving reasons

children.heading: Narrating events
children.content: 買い物に行った。それでこれを買った。 "I went shopping. And then I bought this." Sequential storytelling

children.heading: Casual questions
children.content: それで、どうだった？ "So, how was it?" それで、結果は？ "So, what was the result?" Follow-up questions

sections.heading: それで vs だから

children.heading: それで = neutral result
children.content: 雨だった。それで傘を使った。 "It was raining. So I used an umbrella." Neutral narration What happened next

children.heading: だから = emphasized reason
children.content: 雨だ。だから傘を持って行く。 "It's raining. That's why I'm taking an umbrella." Emphasizes causation Personal reasoning

sections.heading: それで vs それから

children.heading: それで = result/consequence
children.content: 疲れた。それで休んだ。 "I was tired. So I rested." Cause-effect relationship

children.heading: それから = time sequence
children.content: 疲れた。それから休んだ。 "I got tired. After that, I rested." Simple time progression Less causal

children.heading: Prompting more info
children.content: A: 昨日、彼に会った。 B: それで？ A: "Yesterday I met him." B: "And so? / What happened?" Asking for continuation

children.heading: それでどうなった？
children.content: それでどうなったの？ "So what happened?" それで結局？ "So in the end?" Seeking conclusion

children.heading: Sequential narration
children.content: 起きた。それで朝ごはんを食べた。 それで会社に行った。 "I woke up. So I ate breakfast. And then I went to work." Can sound repetitive Vary connectors

children.heading: Using within sentence
children.content: Wrong: 疲れたそれで休んだ ⚠️ Correct: 疲れた。それで休んだ。 ✓ "I was tired. So I rested." Need sentence break

children.heading: Overemphasizing causation
children.content: Unnatural: 春だ。それで花が咲く。⚠️ Better: 春だから花が咲く。✓ "Because it's spring, flowers bloom." Use から/だから for direct cause

children.heading: Changing topics
children.content: それで、話は変わるけど... "So, changing the topic, but..." それで、次は何？ "So, what's next?" Topic transition

children.heading: Natural flow
children.content: 昨日、買い物に行った。それで新しい靴を 買った。それで帰りにカフェに寄った。 "Yesterday I went shopping. So I bought new shoes. And then on the way back I stopped by a cafe." Narrative progression

children.heading: Works with negatives
children.content: 時間がなかった。それで行けなかった。 "I didn't have time. So I couldn't go." 分からなかった。それで聞いた。 "I didn't understand. So I asked." Negative results

children.heading: Logical outcomes
children.content: 勉強しなかった。それで落ちた。 "I didn't study. So I failed." 食べすぎた。それでお腹が痛い。 "I ate too much. So my stomach hurts." Natural consequences

children.heading: Thoughtful pause
children.content: それで...何だっけ？ "So... what was it?" それで...ああ、そうだ。 "So... oh, that's right." Thinking aloud

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 雨が降った。それで家にいた。 "It rained. So I stayed home." 疲れた。それで早く寝た。 "I was tired. So I went to bed early." 道が混んでた。それで遅れた。 "The road was crowded. So I was late." お金がない。それで買えない。 "I don't have money. So I can't buy it." それで、どうだった？ "So, how was it?"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 昨日、電車が遅れた。それで会社に 遅刻してしまった。上司に謝ったけど、 あまり良い顔をされなかった。 "Yesterday the train was delayed. So I ended up being late to work. I apologized to my boss, but he didn't look very pleased." 友達から連絡があった。それで久しぶりに 会うことにした。楽しみだけど、 何を話そうか少し緊張している。 "I got a message from my friend. So we decided to meet after a long time. I'm looking forward to it, but I'm a bit nervous about what to talk about." 先週、風邪を引いた。それで3日間 会社を休んだ。今はもう元気だけど、 仕事が溜まってしまった。 "Last week I caught a cold. So I took three days off from work. I'm fine now, but work has piled up."
